JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are NORP nationals . They were represented before the ORG by PERSON and PERSON , lawyers at ORG , a non - governmental organisation in GPE . ORG were represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . The applicants were all employed as journalists by ORG , a private television and radio company formerly owned by the late NORP media proprietor ORG and by PERSON ORG . The applicants were not shareholders in that company .

CARDINAL . NORP In the autumn of DATE , large - scale demonstrations led by a collection of opposition parties took place in GPE , protesting against the President of GPE and the Government . These demonstrations , to which ORG was sympathetic , were initially peaceful but turned violent on DATE when the police , using various harsh anti - riot tactics , dislodged the demonstrators from land adjoining ORG , preventing them from resuming their protests .
CARDINAL . All major television stations in GPE , including ORG , broadcast live footage of the dispersal of the demonstrators on DATE .

CARDINAL . Later in the evening of CARDINAL DATE , without warning and without possession of a court order , CARDINAL of police officers armed with automatic weapons broke into the ORG television station headquarters , causing the station to be taken off the air . According to the applicants’ version of events which is disputed by the Government , the police forced the ORG staff members , including CARDINAL of the applicants ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , to lie on the floor with their hands behind their heads . Some of the captive journalists were verbally insulted and threatened at gunpoint . After holding the staff members , including the applicants , in the above - mentioned conditions for TIME , the police forced them out of the building , destroying much of the company ’s television equipment and its video archive ( “ the police raid on LOC ” ) . Many other staff members of the television , including the remaining CARDINAL applicants , were , in the meantime , gathered in a street adjacent to the building .

CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE , a criminal case for attempted coup PERSON was initiated against ORG by ORG . Furthermore , the President of GPE declared a nationwide state of emergency DATE which lasted until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) suspended ORG ’s broadcasting licence , citing violations of broadcasting law by the company .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , on DATE ORG opened a criminal probe in the lawfulness of the police actions during the raid on ORG . However , the case file does not contain any decision related to those proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE CARDINAL ORG ’s CARDINAL newly designated lawyers enquired with prosecution authority about progress in the criminal proceedings which had been initiated against their client on CARDINAL DATE , requesting to be acquainted with case materials . As disclosed by copies of those enquiries , the CARDINAL lawyers , who did not possess authority to act from any of the CARDINAL applicants , did not voice any grievances and described any facts concerning the police raid on ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the police allowed the ORG staff members , including the applicants , to re - enter their offices in the television station for the first time . On DATE the ORG lifted the broadcast ban on ORG .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , and notably after ORG ’s death on DATE , a row concerning the question of ownership of ORG broke out between the late media proprietor ’s family and certain other persons . The company management ’s subsequent decision to suspend the television broadcasts again , led most of its leading journalists , including the applicants , to leave their jobs at ORG in DATE . In DATE ORG television , already running under new management , started broadcasting again .

CARDINAL . For DATE after the police raid on ORG on DATE , the applicants did not complain about the actions of the police before any of the domestic authorities . In DATE , ORG , a human rights advocacy centre known in GPE for specialising in bringing applications to the ORG , publicly declared its readiness to assist victims of the police raid on ORG . Subsequently , on CARDINAL and DATE , all CARDINAL applicants simultaneously filed complaints with the GPE public prosecutor ’s office requesting the initiation of a criminal investigation into the circumstances of that raid .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecution authority informed the applicants that their criminal complaints had been transmitted to the investigative unit of ORG for further action .
